content.text: Some people think 'growth' means knowing how to judge.
They stand in the light, watch others hit walls, and conveniently raise a mirror, calling it 'experience.'
Because I've hit too many walls myself; fragments wedged in my bone seams let me see their shadows more clearly.

Reason is the madman's last layer of skin.

I can't peel it off. They can't put it on either.
